name: Monstera Deliciosa
shortDescription: Iconic split leaves, a true statement piece.
longDescription: The Monstera Deliciosa, also known as the Swiss Cheese Plant, is famous for its quirky, natural leaf holes. A favorite among interior designers, it brings a lush, tropical jungle vibe to any room. It's relatively easy to care for and can grow quite large, making it a rewarding experience for both new and experienced plant parents.

care.water: Water every 1-2 weeks, allowing soil to dry out between waterings.
care.light: Thrives in bright to medium indirect light. Not suited for intense, direct sun.
care.fertilizer: Feed with a balanced liquid fertilizer every month during spring and summer.

name: Snake Plant
longDescription: The Sansevieria trifasciata, commonly known as the Snake Plant or Mother-in-Law's Tongue, is one of the most popular and hardy species of houseplants. Its architectural, sword-like leaves make it a perfect fit for modern interiors. It's incredibly low-maintenance and is known for its ability to purify the air.

care.water: Very drought-tolerant. Water every 2-8 weeks, more frequently in brighter light.
care.light: Tolerates a wide range of light conditions, from low light to bright, indirect light.
care.temperature: Happy in a wide range of temperatures, from 15-30°C.
care.fertilizer: Fertilize during the growing season (spring/summer) with an all-purpose plant food.

name: Golden Pothos
shortDescription: Trailing vine, incredibly forgiving for beginners.
longDescription: The Epipremnum aureum, or Golden Pothos, is one of the easiest houseplants to grow. Its heart-shaped, variegated leaves grow on long, trailing vines, making it perfect for hanging baskets or shelves. It's very adaptable and can thrive in a variety of conditions, and it's great at telling you when it needs water.

care.water: Water every 1-2 weeks. It will droop slightly when thirsty.
care.light: Prefers bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light.
care.fertilizer: Feed every 1-2 months during the growing season.

name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
shortDescription: A statement tree that loves bright light.
longDescription: The Ficus lyrata, or Fiddle Leaf Fig, is a stunning plant with huge, violin-shaped leaves. It's a bit of a diva and demands specific conditions, but its dramatic presence is well worth the effort. It enjoys a stable environment with plenty of bright, filtered light and consistent watering.

care.water: Water when the top inch of soil is dry. Do not let it sit in water.
care.light: Needs lots of bright, indirect sunlight. Rotate it regularly.
care.temperature: Keep it in a stable, warm environment (18-24°C). Avoid drafts.
care.fertilizer: Fertilize once a month during the growing season.

name: Calathea Orbifolia
shortDescription: Stunning round foliage with silver stripes.
longDescription: Calathea orbifolia is prized for its large, round, strikingly-patterned leaves. This plant is a member of the 'prayer plant' family, meaning its leaves fold up at night. It requires a bit more attention, particularly regarding humidity, but its beauty is a fantastic reward.

care.water: Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Use filtered water if possible.
care.light: Prefers medium to bright indirect light. Direct sun will scorch the leaves.
care.fertilizer: Feed every two weeks during the growing season with a diluted fertilizer.

name: ZZ Plant
shortDescription: Drought-tolerant and thrives in low light.
longDescription: The Zamioculcas zamiifolia, or ZZ Plant, is the perfect plant for beginners or forgetful waterers. With its wide, dark green, glossy leaves, it looks great and is nearly indestructible. It stores water in its rhizomes, so it's extremely drought-tolerant.

care.water: Allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings. Can go weeks without water.
care.light: Very adaptable. Prefers bright indirect light but tolerates very low light.
care.fertilizer: Fertilize 2-3 times during the growing season.
